conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q placed at the midpoint between the two plates of a parallel-plate capacitor, we can follow these steps:

In a parallel-plate capacitor, the electric field E between the plates is uniform and given by: E = V/d where V is the potential difference between the plates and d is the distance between the plates.
The potential difference V can also be expressed in terms of the charge Q and the capacitance C: V = Q/C
Substitute V = Q/C into the electric field equation: E = Q/Cd
The force F experienced by a point charge q in an electric field E is given by: F = qE
Substitute E = Q/Cd into the force equation: F = q(Q/Cd)
Simplify the expression to find the magnitude of the force: F = qQ/Cd
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q placed at the midpoint between the two plates of the parallel-plate capacitor is: F = qQ/Cd
